brief summary: The most common item type. Depending on their data, they can be placed in the world, picked up, eaten, sold to shops, etc.
Items which can be placed in the world and are two tiles tall (instead of one like objects).
Items which can be equipped in the player's boots slot. These change the player sprite and may provide buffs.
Decorative items which can be placed in the world. In some cases players can sit on them or place items on them.
Items which can be equipped in the player's hat slot. These change the player sprite.
Decorative items which can be placed in the world, and used to store and display clothing.
Items which can be equipped in the player's pants slot. These change the player sprite.
Items which can be equipped in the player's shirt slot. These change the player sprite.
Items that can be swung or used by the player to perform some effect (e.g. dig dirt, chop trees, milk or shear animals, etc).
Items that can be equipped in the player's trinket slot to enable special effects.
Items which can be applied to a decoratable location (e.g. a farmhouse or shed) to visually change its floor or wall design. (These are separate from placeable items like brick floor.)
Items which can be swung or used by the player to damage monsters.
